There is more than one author with this nameSir John Patrick Richardson KBE was a British art historian and Picasso biographer. The elder son o Sir Wodehouse Richardson he was sent to board at two successive schools ater his ather's death in 1929. When he was thirteen he became a boarder at Stowe school where he admired the architecture and landscape and was taught something about the work o Picasso and other innovative painters. Ater bring invalided out o the army in the Second World War he worked in London as an industrial designer and became riends with the painters Francis Bacon and Lucian Freud.In 1949 Richardson met the art historian and collector Douglas Cooper and the two began a relationship that would last ten years. In 1952 he moved with Cooper to Provence where he met a number o artists including Pablo Picasso. In 1960 Richardson let Cooper and moved to New York where he worked in the art world until retiring in 1980 to concentrate ull time on writing. The irst volume o his biography o Picasso was published in 1991 with subsequent volumes published in 1996 and 2007. In 2012 Richardson was appointed Knight Commander o the Order o the British Empire (KBE) or his services to art.

Kevin was born and raised in central Connecticut beore enrolling in James Madison University in 2000. When the terrorist attacks on September 11 2001 claimed the lie o a good riend's ather he decided to leave school in avor o military service. While visiting a Navy recruiter's oice a SEALs poster caught Kevin's eye and he decided to enlist in the Navy with the intention o going to BUD/S and becoming a SEAL. He started BUD/S in early 2003 with Class 245. A back injury meant he would graduate with Class 246 at the end o the year. Because he was a Hospital Corpsman Kevin also attended 18D Special Operations Combat Medic School at Fort Bragg beore checking into SEAL Team THREE in Coronado Caliornia.Kevin did two platoons at SEAL Team THREE (Charlie and Delta) as a platoon sniper breacher and combat medic each with a deployment to Iraq (2006 and 2008). He was ortunate enough to work alongside many o the toughest rogmen to ever wear the trident such as Marc Lee Ryan Job Mikey Monsoor and Chris Kyle. His platoon's 2006 deployment to Ramadi then the most dangerous city in Iraq has been discussed in several books including Chris Kyle's American Sniper. Kevin's presence in Sniper led to his involvement in the production o and eventual casting in the Clint Eastwood directed Chris Kyle biopic by the same name (starring Bradley Cooper).Upon completing his enlistment Kevin was honorably discharged rom the Navy. He was awarded a number o commendations or his service including a Bronze Star with a combat 'V'. He returned to Connecticut and enrolled at UConn with the intention o continuing his career in medicine. He graduated Magna Cum Laude with a degree in Political Science in 2011 and began the application process or Physician Assistant School. While earning his undergraduate degree he also got married and started a amily.In 2012 Kevin moved his amily to Winston-Salem North Carolina in order to pursue his Masters o Health Sciences at Wake Forest University. He graduated in August 2014.Currently Kevin works as a Physician Assistant with Regenesis LLC in Pensacola. He enjoys using his past experiences to acilitate his work in medicine and charity. His past military service inluences him greatly as he seeks to actively support service members and veterans in his community.Kevin lives in Florida with his wie Lindsey and two children.

I wrote the Brad trilogy irst. It began as a story called The Intruder. This was published in Mister magazine. I then sent it to the US where it was again published. The editor thought it would make a good novella. He also thought some sex wouldn't go amiss. There was no sex in Intruder. And so began my journey into erotica. The irst o the Brad trilogy novella was a hit. The other two soon ollowed.I'd been discharged rom the RN or being gay and there was nothing I could do about it. I then thought that maybe there was. I could write about gay sailors having lots o sex on ships. And boy would they have lots o sex. So that is why Brad became a sailor. And the satisying part the RN could do nothing about it. Yes sailors did have sex with each other and the Navy would have to live with it.Next came Virgin Sailors my irst published novel. It did well very quickly and another was asked or. I hadn't anything to give and had not really thought about it. I could only think that the Brad trilogy would make a good novel and suggested this. Publisher agreed and so Brad was born. It still remains my bestselling novel and 13 years on still sells.Writing a novel is hard work. Writing the next one is even harder. You just wonder i you can do it i you really want to do it. A blank page is a very intimidating thing. A blank page every day because that's what you start with is even more so.We all write in dierent ways. Some need to have a plan right down to how many words and chapters setting all the characters and the rest. I right rom the start have no idea what I am about to write. Yes I might have an idea o an ending or the start or something in the middle and oddly even a title but usually I've not a clue where the story will go. And so it was with Going Down.I'd hitched a lot in the navy to save money it was common back then and thought there might be a story there. You meet a lot o weird and wonderul people i you are lucky when hitching. You meet some scary ones too i you are not. And so Luke stepped onto my blank page and set o down the road. I've always ound it exciting wondering where I'd be taken and just as in real lie which path will be taken when the mind creates a crossroad o ideas. Beore I knew it he'd hitched rom Scotland to Dorset and met some very interesting people on his journey.I grew up in my beloved countryside and only ever spent a year o my childhood living in a dreadul town. Not quite true because I was born in London's East End and lived there until I was three. Thankully I recall little o it. Because o this my novels are set between on board ship and countryside romps. Another constant in my writing is humour. I my story has not made you laugh then I've only done hal the job. Fun and laughter is the lieblood o a ship's crew. When you have two hundred sailors living in the same tin can or months you will understand why. The other constant is sex. One o my avourite reviews was a guy who said he'd never laughed so much while sporting a boner and didn't know it was possible.With three novels selling well I began to believe I might have the makings o a writer. I was certainly enjoying writing and amazed mysel that I could write about sex so readily. And write about it I did in Riding the Big One when I sent Sandy to sea. I grew up in Sheeld attended a variety o schools including Bedales in Hampshire and East Brunswick High in New Jersey. I went on to Sussex and Georgetown Universities where I read American Studies and started writing short stories. I joined the BBC in 1980 and worked on everything rom Crimewatch UK to a history o the Falklands War. I also did a spell in Enva Hoxha's Albania on a secret ilming assignment about an MI5/CIA mission there that went horribly wrong. In 1984 I was sent to Sri Lanka or the Real Lives series to report on the uprising against the Tamils and the diary I kept o that time became the basis or Perect Night. I moved on to Channel 4 where I was head o HistoryReligion and Features and indulged my passion or cars in several programme commissions. I also ound mysel in charge o Big Brother 3 the one that gave the world Jade Goody. Ater a brie oray into the brave new world o Yahoo (source o the sacking scene in Perect Night) I returned to TV as a reelancer but determined to write. Perect Night was the result. My two biggest inuences were and still are my wie Stephanie Calman (see Badmothersclub.com)and my agent Mark Lucas who showed what thriller writing was all about. Just Watch Me came about ater a bad day at Gatwick Airport discovering that my then ive year old daughter's passport had expired and instead o heading or Tobago I ound mysel in Durham where the only passport oice in the land would give me a replacement over the counter. Set in Britain Tobago and Aghanistan it tells the story o a man who loses his amily and has to go on the run while he tries to ind out why.My last two books Battleield 3 - The Russian (with Andy McNab)and Battleield 4 - Countdown to War have been written in association with Electronic Arts publishers o the Battleield global game ranchise. To EA's great credit they gave me the space to develop an autonomous story using some the games' characters and situations as launch pads or stand-alone narratives. You do not have to be a 'gamer' (I'm not - there I've conessed)to enjoy them in act you don't need to know anthing at all about the games or how it relates to the books. But i you ind them via the games they should add to your appreciation o the characters who pass through.

Tom A. Coburn M.D. was elected to the U.S. Senate on November 2 2004. Dr. Coburn and his wie Carolyn a graduate o Oklahoma State University and ormer Miss Oklahoma were married in 1968 and have three children and ive grandchildren. They are members o First Baptist Muskogee.Prior to his election to the Senate Dr. Coburn represented Oklahoma's Second Congressional District in the House o Representatives rom 1995 through 2001. He was irst elected in 1994 then re-elected in 1996 and 1998 becoming the irst Republican to hold the seat or consecutive terms. Dr. Coburn retired rom Congress in 2001 ulilling his pledge to serve no more than three terms in the House. In 1970 Dr. Coburn graduated with an accounting degree rom Oklahoma State University. One o the Top Ten seniors in the School o Business Dr. Coburn served as president o the College o Business Student Council. From 1970 to 1978 Dr. Coburn served as manuacturing manager at the Ophthalmic Division o Coburn Optical Industries in Colonial Heights Virginia. Under his leadership the Virginia division o Coburn Optical grew rom 13 employees to more than 350 and captured 35 percent o the U.S. market. Ater the amily business was sold Dr. Coburn changed the course o his lie by returning to school to become a physician. Again he emerged as a leader becoming president o his class at the University o Oklahoma Medical School where he graduated in 1983. He then did his internship in general surgery at St. Anthony's Hospital in Oklahoma City and amily practice residency at the University o Arkansas Fort Smith. Dr. Coburn returned to Muskogee where he specializes in amily medicine obstetrics and the treatment o allergies. Dr. Coburn has personally delivered more than 4000 babies. Dr. Coburn also is a three-time cancer survivor.

Germain received a doctorate in philosophy rom the Sorbonne and taught it at the French School in Prague rom 1987 to 1993.She claimed that philosophy 'a continuous wonder' to her was also too 'analytical' and she switched rom Descartes and Heidegger to Kaka and Dostoevsky.She grew up in rural France in an area steeped in mythology and olklore and she admitted 'that the power o place had a huge eect on me but it was an unconscious one'. That her prose was 'related to the earth ... the soil the peasants the trees' was revealed in her irst novel The Book o Nights (1985) which won six literary awards.The second novel Night o Amber (1987) continued rom the irst and was ollowed by Days o Anger (1989). It took me our years to research write and revise my irst novel The Shadow Catchers and it would be another two years beore the book was published by St. Martin's Press. The dream o being a writer has been with me or a considerably longer time.By the time I was ive years old I'd mapped out exactly what I was going to do with my lie: I would be (in no particular order) a Superhero an Astronaut and a Mad Scientist. Two years later I'd added Actor and Cartoonist to the list. By the end o the ith grade I'd inally decided that I could accomplish all o these by telling stories or a living. To this day whenever I see one o those movies about talking pigs who save the arm I remember Napoleon the hog sending Boxer the horse to the butcher's in exchange or a barrel o whiskey. And I go make mysel a nice ham sandwich with pork rinds.I was born in Mobile Alabama on March 10 1964 the youngest o six children. My parents made sure we all got an education. Ater high school I attended the University o the South a liberal arts school owned by the Episcopal Church. Popularly known as Sewanee the college allowed me to pursue all my interests as well as helping to develop new ones. Ater earning my B.A. I studied Theatre in Great Britain and Ireland on a Thomas J. Watson ellowship then received my M.F.A. in Playwriting rom Carnegie-Mellon University.My irst real job was in the marketing department at Universal Pictures where I got to do just about everything rom publicity to speechwriting and creative design. In 1994 I helped start Digital Planet one o the irst Internet design irms to specialize in entertainment marketing. My business partner and I had already created the irst interactive movie press kit (or Sneakers) and were soon designing sites and DVDS or all the major studios as well as corporate clients like Intel and the United States Postal Service. We also produced the Internet's irst ully animated series Madeleine's Mind. In 1998 Digital Planet was acquired by a corporate parent. I stayed on or two years as L.A. creative director then took a brie stint at another company DNA Studio. I let the business not long ater the dotcom bust o 2000. I'm very happy I had my Caliornia adventure...and I'm not sorry it ended. I knew I had to move on i I was going to make my iction career happen.Ater our challenging and invigorating years teaching Literature and Creative Writing at the University o South Alabama I decided to devote mysel to writing ull-time. Currently I'm living on the Alabama Gul Coast working on my ourth novel while preparing or the March 2009 publication o Broken Wing. My latest adventure has returned me to my early love o the theatre: next year I am honored to serve as the Tennessee Williams playwright-in-residence at my alma mater Sewanee.

Rosemary Verey OBE VMH was an internationally known English garden designer lecturer and proliic garden writer who designed the amous garden at Barnsley House near Cirencester.She was born Rosemary Isabel Baird Sandilands and educated at Eversley School Folkestone and University College London. In 1984 when her husband David died Rosemary began designing gardens or American and British clients. Most notable are HRH the Prince o Wales Elton John Princess Michael o Kent the Marquess o Bute and the New York Botanical Garden.Rosemary Verey was well known or taking imposing elements rom large public gardens and bringing them into scale or the home gardeners use. Her laburnum walk which has been photographed many times is an example o this technique. The National Trust's Bodnant Garden in North Wales has a very large laburnum walk that inspired Verey to plant a similar smaller scale laburnum walk at Barnsley House. Verey is also noted or making vegetable (ornamental potager) gardens ashionable once again. The potager at Barnsley House was inspired by that at Villandry on the Loire in France.She was awarded the OBE in 1996 and in 1999 rom the Royal Horticultural Society the highest accolade that Society can award the Victoria Medal o Honour (VMH).

Sylvia Longmire is a service-disabled veteran mother author consultant entrepreneur world traveler and the ormer Ms. Wheelchair USA 2016. She traveled extensively rom an early age and during her time as an Air Force oicer and Special Agent. Ater she was diagnosed with multiple sclerosis (MS) in 2005 her ability to walk started to deteriorate. Fortunately the progression o her MS was slow enough that she could gradually adapt to new ways o living. Sylvia had to learn how to travel with a walker and eventually with an electric scooter. Her work as a consultant has taken her all across the United States and her addiction to leisure travel has taken her (and her scooter) as ar as the deserts o Dubai and the glaciers o Alaska. She oten travels alone and is continually invigorated by the kindness and oers o help rom strangers in every corner o this beautiul world. However Sylvia is battling the clock. MS is a progressive disease without a cure and she doesn t know how much longer her body will allow her to travel. So as long as her wallet allows Sylvia is knocking both domestic and international destinations o her bucket list as quickly as she can She chooses her destinations based on their levels o wheelchair accessibility as well as whether she ll be able to travel there alone or need a companion. Her goals are twoold: to educate people at home and abroad about the needs and capabilities o disabled travelers and to encourage people with disabilities to leave their ears behind and seek adventure. Through her photography rom the vantage point o a seated position Sylvia hopes to inspire other wheelies to create their own photo-worthy moments abroad. When she s not traveling Sylvia works as a consultant and subject matter expert on Mexico s drug war and border security issues. She has two books in print Cartel and Border Insecurity and she has appeared on most major national news and radio networks. She is also an accessible travel agent and owns/manages the Spin the Globe / Travel agency. Sylvia is a single mom to two amazing boys who inspired her to orm The PreJax Foundation a 501(c)(3) nonproit that provides college scholarships to students with MS or who have a parent with MS. All proceeds rom the sale o The View rom Down Here will be donated to the Foundation.

When you're not writing how do you spend your time? Eating chocolate. Okay seriously? I'm usually working at my day job reading or helping my daughter with her homework. People who know me know that I'm not kidding about the chocolate. :-) How do you discover the ebooks you read? I search online or riends tell me i they've read something they enjoyed. Otherwise I wait until a book title comes to me in a dream. Really. Do you remember the irst story you ever wrote? Yes! I wrote it many years ago. It wasn't even a story. It was a scene and I thought it was great. It wasn't. What is your writing process? When I come up with an idea I do some research to lesh it out. I I decide it will make an interesting book I start jotting down plot points. Once I get that I note what I think should happen in each chapter. It's just a couple o sentences. Then I elaborate on that and include a sentence or two about the scenes in the chapter. Okay we're going back to the dream again here. But I'm serious this time. :-) Sometimes when I'm driving to or rom work I sort o daydream. I think most o us do that. From time to time when I daydream thoughts o my book come to me and the characters start talking in my head. When that happens while I'm driving I grab my mini digital recorder and speak into it. I get the same thoughts when I'm in bed trying to all asleep. I usually turn on the light and start writing. And there you have it. Do you remember the irst story you ever read and the impact it had on you? Uh no. No I don't. Now that the question has been asked I'm eeling a bit sad that I don't remember. Okay lie goes on. I'm over it. Next question. How do you approach cover design? For my irst cover I printed out online book covers o the authors I enjoy reading. I looked at the covers o the books I own. I studied the opinions o book designers on what made a good cover. Since I'm sure nobody would take a second look at a book cover I drew I browsed stock images. A LOT o stock images. I wanted an image that created an emotional reaction in me. I think i it does that or me it may also do it or a reader browsing or books. I used a ont that was recommended or the type o book I wrote. For the cover o my second book I had an idea in mind and went back to the stock images. Hopeully that book (Criminal Negligence) will be ready by the end o 2014. I it's not well then it's not. Shoot me. What do you read or pleasure? Mysteries/Suspense. I like my heart to race. Well except i it involves running. I don't want that. In a book I like trying to igure out what's going on beore the author tells me. I I can't igure out who did the dirty deed and the story is compelling I'll read that author again. In act I'll seek out their next book and probably buy all o the series. I preer to read series. What is your e-reading device o choice? Currently it's the Kindle 6
